messages: e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (18:22): can I setup HA with Oracle XE ?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:22): depends on what you mean with HA
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:23): you can put oracle xe on a shared disk system and have an active/passive setup
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:23): or use poor mans dataguard (scripts to sync logfiles and apply)
e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (18:23): I usually put master and hot standby
e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (18:23): heartbeat + single ip
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:24): sure no problem
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:24): as long as you have the backend to support it
e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (18:24): I need SAN also here, right ?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:24): a good scsi array will do fine
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:25): take a dell 220 with dual cluster compatible controllers and raid cards (perc4dc)
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:25): or a hp msa array... or ibm exp
e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (18:25): and attach it to 2 boxes ?
e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (18:25): slave and master right ?
e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (18:26): scsi array becomes a point of failure then ?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:26): yes and no... it is very very unlikely that the array will fail so badly that it will cause downtime
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:26): you have two controllers in the array
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:26): the only non-redundant part will be the backplane and the enclosure itself
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:27): i don't think i've ever seen a normal scsi backplane die
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:27): use two arrays if you are paranoid... performance will be quite sucky tho
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:27): and you need a cluster aware software raid solution (vxvm)
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:28): or gfs from redhat/centos
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:29): i'm implementing a small ha system in a few weeks... two dell 2950's and a dell ax150 array.. very cheap
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:29): and redhat cluster server
c7f657e53de73d701a201d626b0a78d7 (18:31): you can probably do a mirrored disk situation with two cabinets without a clustered filesystem
c7f657e53de73d701a201d626b0a78d7 (18:32): though I agree with hali, that's pretty paranoid

443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:32): most basic raid controllers don't support split bus mirroring... i have asked hp and dell about it... you can't use four raid cards and two arrays in HW mode :(
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:32): you can probably use two cards with dual ports tho...
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:33): thats probably a decent solution
c7f657e53de73d701a201d626b0a78d7 (18:33): right, not in hw mode
c7f657e53de73d701a201d626b0a78d7 (18:33): it'd be software
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:34): hm, asm should be able to do it when i think of it
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:35): using mirroring in asm.. should be a quite clean solution
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:35): without cluster filesystems and extra software raid layers...
